packages/zod/src/v4/classic/tests/json-schema.test.ts (1) `371-416`: **Nice test coverage for the new multiple pattern feature!** The test cases look solid and cover the key scenarios: - Chained string methods (`startsWith`, `includes`, `endsWith`) - Multiple regex patterns - Proper `allOf` structure in the generated JSON Schema The expected outputs correctly show how each pattern becomes its own schema object within the `allOf` array, which is exactly how JSON Schema should handle multiple pattern constraints.
packages/zod/src/v4/core/checks.ts (5) `7-7`: **Good import addition for type safety.** Adding the `$ZodStringInternals` import enables proper type casting for the bag property access in the pattern management code below. --- `783-791`: **Clean pattern accumulation logic in string format checks.** The logic to manage multiple patterns in a Set is well implemented: - Checks if `bag.patterns` already exists before adding - Creates new Set if needed - Consistent with the updated data structure The type casting to `$ZodStringInternals["bag"]` is necessary for accessing the `patterns` property. --- `954-959`: **Consistent pattern management in includes check.** Same clean logic as the string format check - accumulates patterns in the Set properly. The pattern creation using `escapeRegex` for the includes value is correct. --- `1001-1006`: **Proper pattern handling for startsWith check.** The regex pattern construction with `^${util.escapeRegex(def.prefix)}.*` correctly anchors to the start and the Set management follows the established pattern. --- `1048-1053`: **Good pattern handling for endsWith check.** The regex pattern `.*${util.escapeRegex(def.suffix)}$` correctly anchors to the end and the Set management is consistent with the other checks.
packages/zod/src/v4/core/to-json-schema.ts (1) `2-2`: **LGTM on the import additions!** The new imports for `$ZodStringFormats` and `$ZodStringInternals` are correctly added to support the enhanced string pattern functionality. Also applies to: 6-6
packages/zod/src/v4/core/schemas.ts (2) `692-693`: **IPv4: attach `format` metadata in the bag** Nice move casting the bag and setting `bag.format = "ipv4"` on attach—this ensures `toJSONSchema` will pick up the standard `"ipv4"` format tag. --- `716-717`: **IPv6: attach `format` metadata in the bag** Same deal here—attaching `bag.format = "ipv6"` via the hook will drive the right `"ipv6"` format in your JSON Schema.

packages/zod/src/v4/core/api.ts (1)
`62-74`: _💡 Verification agent_
🧩 Analysis chain **Great fix for Hermes compatibility issue!** Replacing direct class instantiation with the `safeCreateSchema` utility function addresses the core issue with Hermes throwing "Cannot call a class as a function" errors. This change is exactly what's needed to fix the problem while maintaining the same function signature and behavior. However, I notice that similar changes haven't been made to other schema creators like `_email`, `_uuid`, etc. To fully fix Hermes compatibility, you'll need to update those as well. Let's check if other schema creators in this file still use direct instantiation: --- 🏁 Script executed: ```shell #!/bin/bash # Check for direct schema instantiation patterns in api.ts grep -n "return new Class" packages/zod/src/v4/core/api.ts | head -5 ``` Length of output: 193 ---
**Update other schema creators for Hermes compatibility** Nice work swapping out the direct instantiation in `_string`—we need to do the same for the rest to avoid that “Cannot call a class as a function” error in Hermes. Please replace every ```js return new Class({ … }); ``` in these functions with the `safeCreateSchema(...)` pattern: • packages/zod/src/v4/core/api.ts – `_email` (line 80) – `_uuid` (line 94) – `_url` (line 110) – `_cuid` (line 126) – `_cuid2` (line 142) Example for `_email`: ```diff -export function _email( - Class: util.SchemaClass, - params?: $ZodEmailParams -): T { - return new Class({ - type: "email", - ...util.normalizeParams(params), - }); -} +export function _email( + Class: util.SchemaClass, + params?: $ZodEmailParams +): T { + return safeCreateSchema( + Class, + { + type: "email", + ...util.normalizeParams(params), + }, + "email" + ); +} ``` Apply the same transformation (adjusting the `type` string and params type) to `_uuid`, `_url`, `_cuid`, and `_cuid2`.

The exposed properties will help you diagnose and fix the Hermes incompatibility issues mentioned in the PR.
packages/hermes-test/app/(tabs)/_layout.tsx (2) `5-9`: **Clean import organization** Good job organizing your imports with local components and hooks grouped together. --- `11-46`: **Nice tab layout implementation with iOS-specific enhancements** Your tab layout with haptic feedback and platform-specific styling looks great. The conditional styling for iOS to enable the blur effect is a nice touch.
packages/zod/src/v4/core/api.ts (1) `6-6`: **Good safeguard import for Hermes compatibility** Adding an explicit import for the `safeCreateSchema` function is a necessary step for implementing the Hermes compatibility fix.
packages/hermes-test/components/ui/TabBarBackground.ios.tsx (3) `1-4`: **Good use of platform-specific imports** Using the React Navigation bottom tab bar height hook for iOS is smart. This will help ensure your UI adapts correctly to the iOS tab bar. --- `5-15`: **Clean iOS-native blur implementation** Nice work implementing the iOS blur effect with appropriate tint and intensity settings. The use of `StyleSheet.absoluteFill` ensures it covers the entire area. The comments explaining the system adaptation are helpful for future developers. --- `17-19`: **Smart platform-specific tab overflow handling** This hook provides the actual tab bar height on iOS, which pairs nicely with the zero-value implementation for other platforms. This allows for consistent component interfaces across platforms with platform-specific behavior.
